Module erik.wiesi
Package erik.wiesi.sprites

Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
erik.wiesi.sprites.Sprite
public class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Sprite​(Spritesheet spritesheet)
    create new empty Sprite with given Spritesheet, Size of the Canvas is defined by the TileSize of the given Spritesheet
    Sprite​(Spritesheet spritesheet, int width, int height)
    Create new empty Sprite with given Spritesheet Size of the Canvas is defined by given width and height

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addSprite​(int x, int y)
    Adds a new Sprite as a top Layer to this Sprite's Canvas x and y counter have to be defined referencing this Sprite's Spritesheet
    void addSprite​(int x, int y, int cx, int cy)
    * Adds a new Sprite as a top Layer to this Sprite's Canvas x and y counter have to be defined referencing this Sprite's Spritesheet cx and cy are the Position on the Canvas to be drawn at this Canvas, considers tilesize
    javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas getCanvas()  
    void resetCanvas()
    sets this Sprite's Canvas to NULL and recreats the Canvas
    void setLayout​(double x, double y)
    Simple method for defining x and y position on the pane at the same time
    void setScale​(int s)
    this method defines total scale of this Sprite for x and y at the same time

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Sprite

      public Sprite​(Spritesheet spritesheet)
      create new empty Sprite with given Spritesheet, Size of the Canvas is defined by the TileSize of the given Spritesheet
      Parameters:
      spritesheet - Spritesheet used as reference for this Sprite

    • Sprite

      public Sprite​(Spritesheet spritesheet, int width, int height)
      Create new empty Sprite with given Spritesheet Size of the Canvas is defined by given width and height
      Parameters:
      spritesheet - spritesheet Spritesheet used as reference for this Sprite
      width - defines width of the new Canvas
      height - defines height of the new Canvas

  • Method Details

    • getCanvas

      public javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas getCanvas()
      Returns:
      returns this Sprite's Canvas

    • resetCanvas

      public void resetCanvas()
      sets this Sprite's Canvas to NULL and recreats the Canvas

    • addSprite

      public void addSprite​(int x, int y)
      Adds a new Sprite as a top Layer to this Sprite's Canvas x and y counter have to be defined referencing this Sprite's Spritesheet
      Parameters:
      x - defines x Counter from left to right for the chosen Sprite on this Sprite's predefined Spritesheet
      y - defines y Counter from top to bottom for the chosen Sprite on this Sprite's predefined Spritesheet

    • addSprite

      public void addSprite​(int x, int y, int cx, int cy)
      * Adds a new Sprite as a top Layer to this Sprite's Canvas x and y counter have to be defined referencing this Sprite's Spritesheet cx and cy are the Position on the Canvas to be drawn at this Canvas, considers tilesize
      Parameters:
      x - defines x Counter from left to right for the chosen Sprite on this Sprite's predefined Spritesheet
      y - defines y Counter from top to bottom for the chosen Sprite on this Sprite's predefined Spritesheet
      cx - defines x counter to be drawn at this Canvas, considers tilesize
      cy - defines y counter to be drawn at this Canvas, considers tilesize

    • setScale

      public void setScale​(int s)
      this method defines total scale of this Sprite for x and y at the same time
      Parameters:
      s - defines total scale

    • setLayout

      public void setLayout​(double x, double y)
      Simple method for defining x and y position on the pane at the same time
      Parameters:
      x - defines x position
      y - defines y position
